id: X Factor’s Molly Scott is performing BTS again on tonight’s X Factor and let’s just give her the prize already
paragraph: 135.6m sharesAfter sailing through to The X Factor live shows with her rendition of BTS’ Fake Love, it’s no wonder Molly Scott is going to be reworking the K-pop anthem once again tonight.The 16-year-old blew the socks off Simon Cowell at his particularly extra Judges’ Houses when she performed in front of an onslaught of musical heavyweights – including the original American Idol judges and host, Ryan Seacrest.Hoping to repeat the same success with the first public vote of the series, Molly will be taking on the BTS tune for a second time in front of millions.The BTS ARMY flocked to praise Molly’s first take on the hit, which she performed in English, in their droves with comments ranging from ‘this is insane’, to ‘we’re in awe’. And quite rightly too, as you can see for yourself below:As for her rivals, we’ve got renditions of Ariana Grande, Niall Horan and David Bowie, while Anthony Russell, 28, will be recreating the magic from his first audition in 2017 by performing Julia Michaels’ Issues.And it appears Danny Tetley will be taking to the stage, following a wobbly few days which saw the 37-year-old pull out of rehearsals after falling ill at the worst possible moment.‘He was so unwell on Wednesday that bosses decided it was for the best that he went home,’ a source told Daily Star.‘Right now his main focus is getting better, but with the live shows kicking off on Saturday, everything is up in the air as to if he’s well enough to perform.’Thankfully, he’s currently pencilled in to belt out Mariah Carey’s Hero.The X Factor live shows kick off tonight at 8.25pm on ITV.If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.MORE: X Factor’s Anthony Russell opens up on the drug battle which almost killed him: ‘I’d be dead without Louis Tomlinson’MORE: Nile Rodgers reveals Niall Horan was Louis Tomlinson’s first pick for X Factor’s Judges’ Houses: ‘I only did it as a favour’
